articles.summary: Zhimin Qian, a Chinese national, has been convicted in connection with what is believed to be the world's largest cryptocurrency seizure worth more than £5bn ($6.7bn). She defrauded 128,000 people in China between 2014 and 2017 and stored the proceeds in bitcoin. Qian fled China using false documents and entered the UK, where she tried to launder the money through property purchases. Qian was assisted by Jian Wen, who was sentenced last year to six years and eight months in prison.

articles.summary: Zhimin Qian, 47, has been convicted of playing a key role in the largest cryptocurrency seizure in the world worth more than £5.5bn ($7.4bn) Qian led a large-scale scam in China between 2014 and 2017, cheating more than 128,000 victims and storing the stolen funds in bitcoin assets. Qian fled China using false documents and entered the UK to launder the stolen money by buying property. Qian is being held in custody ahead of sentencing.
